dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news this week, uh, coming out of Sweden, right? Julian Assange, Wikileaks founder â€“ they're reopening that rape investigation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news this week, uh, coming out of Sweden, right? Julian Assange, Wikileaks founder - they're reopening that rape investigation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sweden is reopening an investigation into allegations of rape against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that. It's, like, after all this time, too. I mean, the alleged victim's lawyer requested it again back in April.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that. It's, like, after all this time, too. I mean, the alleged victim's lawyer requested it again back in April.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The announcement landed Monday, after the lawyer for the alleged victim requested in early April the Swedish Prosecution Authority look into the case again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. And he's always denied these, uh, these allegations, which first came up, what, in 2010?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. And he's always denied these, uh, these allegations, which first came up, what, in twenty ten?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange, who denies the rape allegations first made in 2010, has faced numerous legal actions over the last month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a long time ago. And, you know, he's just had, like, a *ton* of legal stuff happening lately anyway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a long time ago. And, you know, he's just had, like, a ton of legal stuff happening lately anyway.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. Seven years in that Ecuadorian embassy, then arrested for breaking bail, now facing, uh, 50 weeks in jail for that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. Seven years in that Ecuadorian embassy, then arrested for breaking bail, now facing, uh, fifty weeks in jail for that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Having spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he'd taken asylum to avoid extradition to Sweden, Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And don't forget the US indictment too, for, like, conspiring with Chelsea Manning to crack a military password.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And don't forget the U S indictment too, for, like, conspiring with Chelsea Manning to crack a military password.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He was also indicted by the U.S. government over an alleged conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack the password of a military computer in order to steal sensitive files.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's right! That's a whole other can of worms, isn't it? But getting back to Sweden, they actually dropped this case in 2017, didn't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's right! That's a whole other can of worms, isn't it? But getting back to Sweden, they actually dropped this case in twenty seventeen, didn't they?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Swedish prosecutors had initially dropped the case in 2017, after deciding they'd exhausted all possible avenues to properly investigate the allegations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They did, yeah. They said they'd exhausted all avenues, and a big reason was that Assange, um, refused to cooperate back then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did, yeah. They said they'd exhausted all avenues, and a big reason was that Assange, um, refused to cooperate back then.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That Assange had refused to cooperate was one significant factor in the case being suspended, the prosecutor's office said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So what changed? I mean, why now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So what changed? I mean, why now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, now he's *out* of the embassy, right? He's in a London prison. So, like, the original condition for reopening it, back in 2017, was if he ever returned to Sweden.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, now he's out of the embassy, right? He's in a London prison. So, like, the original condition for reopening it, back in twenty seventeen, was if he ever returned to Sweden.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But if Julian Assange was to return to Sweden in August 2020, the preliminary investigation could be reopened, director of public prosecution, Marianne Ny, said at the time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, okay, that makes sense. So now he's, um, accessible, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, okay, that makes sense. So now he's, um, accessible, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And this means he could be extradited to Sweden, or... the US. That's the big question.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And this means he could be extradited to Sweden, or the U S. That's the big question.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With Assange now out of the embassy and in a London prison, he could now face extradition to Sweden or the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the extradition hearings for the US have already started, haven't they? But they'll take, like, months.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the extradition hearings for the U S have already started, haven't they? But they'll take, like, months.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hearings into his possible extradition to America have begun, but will likely take months to conclude.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They will. And, um, if there's a conflict between a European arrest warrant and a US request, the UK authorities will decide which one takes priority.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They will. And, um, if there's a conflict between a European arrest warrant and a U S request, the U K authorities will decide which one takes priority.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the event of a conflict between a European arrest warrant and a request for extradition from the U.S., U.K. authorities will decide on the order of priority.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So it's, like, a really complicated situation with multiple countries involved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So it's, like, a really complicated situation with multiple countries involved.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But the Swedish prosecutor said, um, their case *can* proceed concurrently. They'll ask to interview him in the UK.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But the Swedish prosecutor said, um, their case can proceed concurrently. They'll ask to interview him in the U K.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, in my view the Swedish case can proceed concurrently with the proceedings in the U.K. Persson said investigators will ask for an interview with Assange in the U.K.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, again, will require him to cooperate, right? Like he didn't before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, again, will require him to cooperate, right? Like he didn't before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Persson said investigators will ask for an interview with Assange in the U.K., but noted it would require the Wikileaks founder to cooperate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. And, uh, his legal team couldn't be reached for comment, which is kinda telling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. And, uh, his legal team couldn't be reached for comment, which is kinda telling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange's legal team couldn't be reached for comment at the time of publication.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] So, really, still very much up in the air for Julian Assange.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, really, still very much up in the air for Julian Assange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's anyone's guess what happens next.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's anyone's guess what happens next.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The outcome of this process is impossible to predict, said deputy director of public prosecution Eva-Marie Persson.
